string_table.name: npnxnanbnsnfns10101101101
string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript: <Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Before we start, I’d like to empathize with your role at Jamjoom Pharma. You are a great asset to the organization, and it considers you a success partner. it puts a huge trust in you to leverage profitability and growth. Therefore, and in order to support you in your mission, Jamjoom's Academy offers you this course to sharpen your negotiation skills." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="I would encourage to write a message to your future self after finishing course. what would you expect to learn so that you can reflect on your expectation at the end of the course." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Great , Lets start with a simple situation that you can encounter one day ..
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="As you saw, we need to reach a common ground with others in most situations we deal with people. this is what negotiation all about. Negotiation is “ Negotiating is the art of reaching an agreement by resolving differences through creativity” 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="As you have needs, the other parties have needs as well. Therefore, the best way to get what you aspire, is by providing the other parties a solution for their needs. It may seem easy to do so , but reaching an agreement that make everybody happy is yet challenging . " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Actually situations that involve negotiation can end in 4 ways. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="1-One party get what he want, and the others don't, and this is called win-lose or lose-win negotiation based on the affected party 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="2- Neither party gets any thing , and this is called lose-lose negotiation 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="3- The parties work together to discover a third alternative that satisfies the needs of both, and that is called win-win negotiation and this is the best approach. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="But what drives situations into these different ends? well, lets see the following video demonstration of negotiation to know more about negotiation drivers. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="After you have watched the video lets discuss some questions about the case " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="In this slide, the instructor will reflect on the negotiation highlighting the negotiation issues with a focus on the style, negotiation type " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Now, I’d like to ask you a question, what makes a good negotiator. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Click on the image to share your thoughts with your colleagues. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Good negotiator should be 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Calm with clear mind 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Excellent communicator
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Patient 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Moreover he should have all necessary information about the other party and their concerns " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Benjamin Franklin said” By failing to prepare, your are preparing fail” . There fore, it is crucial to plan for your negotiation before your persuing it. To do so, there are something need to consider, lets discover them by moving to the next slide. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="You also need to Identify BATNA. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Most of us will do almost whatever it takes to avoid impasse at the bargaining table. This aversion to impasse may lead a negotiator to become less competitive, leading to a lower reservation price, demands, and counteroffers in order to secure any agreement at all.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="However, And as mentioned HBS, a BATNA can protect you from accepting terms that are too unfavorable and from rejecting terms it would be in your interest to accept 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Furthermore, a strong BATNA can also enhance your power in negotiation. That’s because telling a counterpart that you have a strong alternative to doing business with them can motivate them to compromise to keep you from walking away.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Examples for BATNA 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="When thinking about negotiations strategically, knowledge of your BATNA allows you to leverage your position at the bargaining table." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="The following do’s and don’ts will help you manage information about your BATNA with confidence: 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Never share your BATNA with the other party if it is hopelessly weak.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="If the other side asks you about your BATNA directly, explain (truthfully) that you are working on various possibilities but want to concentrate on the deal on the table for the time being.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Even if you’re certain your BATNA is rock solid, hold off on revealing it. It could prove to be a useful bargaining chip during the final stages of a negotiation after you’ve exhausted all other strategies.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Don’t be surprised if your counterpart disparages your BATNA. Recognize that he has very real incentives to convince you that your outside options are not as good as you’d like to believe." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Now, It is Quiz time .. ." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="In this slide the instructor will provide a summary of the key messages in this part. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="In this slide, the instructor will inform learners on what will they learn in the next modules. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Thank you for your time, and looking forward to seeing you in the next module." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Before we start, I’d like to empathize with your role at Jamjoom Pharma. You are a great asset to the organization, and it considers you a success partner. it puts a huge trust in you to leverage profitability and growth. Therefore, and in order to support you in your mission, Jamjoom's Academy offers you this course to sharpen your negotiation skills." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="However, And as mentioned HBS, a BATNA can protect you from accepting terms that are too unfavorable and from rejecting terms it would be in your interest to accept

" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Examples for BATNA 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="When thinking about negotiations strategically, knowledge of your BATNA allows you to leverage your position at the bargaining table." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="If the other side asks you about your BATNA directly, explain (truthfully) that you are working on various possibilities but want to concentrate on the deal on the table for the time being.
